Note: Black dashboard interior with light beige ceiling

Participant says that screen clarity is much better when focusing on the portion of the black dashboard that is covered by a shadow. Screen clarity while looking at windshield is very difficult to see

Participant says they are not able to identify what’s happening in the external environment as they are watching content on MR display unless something catches their peripheral vision and causes them to look up and away from black dashboard
2025 Hyundai Elantra
Participant is not liking his experience watching reels in the car as he is feeling a bit car sick, describing it as a need to take deep breaths
Participant says they much prefer watching reels on the phone over the glasses because they can see the traffic moving in the periphery of their vision which contributes to their car sickness feeling
Participant says they would not be watching any form of moving content like videos on any device if they were actually on a real road trip
Participant says they even avoid watching movies on planes to avoid motion sickness
Participant says they feel the need to look up and straight periodically to recenter themselves since they are particularly susceptible to car sickness
Participant expresses desire to be able to open map, expand it, and drag it around so that they may have a general understanding and sense about their environment

Participant says they aren’t really able to explore the general area using the map in MR display because it doesn’t specify the street names or other identifiable markers. Says the app is not helpful because it only shows you the nearest location you’re requesting but not exits or other important info in a broad view
Pass Window: 2209, 2378, 2409
Participant feels a bit of vertigo and requested a small break from watching reels
Participant took about a 5 minute break from watching content while we stopped to take lux measurements and they say that helped them feel a bit better
Participant feeling a bit dizzy but does not feel like they are going to throw up
Participant is glad we are switching from glasses to phone for reels because they are feeling dizzy but phone makes them feel less dizzy than glasses display
Participant feels dizziness and headache and says this is the longest time spent watching videos at any one time and says they’d likely never do this
